definition: the Qin army (model for the terracotta warriors)
surname Qin/Qin dynasty (221-207 BC) of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]/abbr. for 陝西|陕西[Shan3 xi1]

sentences.english: After nine fierce battles, the Qin army was finally defeated.
sentences.chinese: 果然，部隊經過九次激烈的戰鬥，終於打垮了秦軍。

sentences.english: After mine fierce battles, the Qin army was finally defeated.
sentences.chinese: 果然部隊經過九次激烈的戰鬥終於打垮了秦軍。

sentences.english: As a result, they were surrounded by the army of Qin till the supplies were exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 結果，趙軍被秦軍包圍，直至彈盡糧絕。

sentences.english: Gird yourselves to defy death, do not give one step. Defeat the Qin army!
sentences.chinese: 大家要拿出拼命精神，不許後退一步，要戰勝秦軍。

definition: Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
see 楚漢戰爭|楚汉战争[Chu3 Han4 Zhan4 zheng1]
Sima Zhao (211-265), military general and statesman of Cao Wei 曹魏[Cao2 Wei4]
to go on a punitive expedition
Nurhaci (1559-1626), founder and first Khan of the Manchu Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金 (from 1616)

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
